Song.title: Hallelujah, What A Savior (Kauflin)
Song.copyright: Words & Music by Philip Bliss Arr. by Bob Kauflin Arr. © 1998 Sovereign Grace Praise

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [F#m7 | D2 | F#m7 | D2 |]
Verse 1: [F#m9]“Man of Sorrows,” [D2]what a name [F#m9]For the Son of [D2]God who came [F#m9]Ruined sinners [F#m9/E]to reclaim Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| Dmaj9]
Verse 2: [F#m]Bearing shame and [C#m/E]scoffing rude [Dmaj7]In my place con[C#m7]demned He stood [F#m7]Sealed my pardon [C#m/E]with His blood Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| Dmaj9]
Verse 3: [F#m7]Guilty, vile, and [C#m/E]helpless we [Dmaj7]Spotless Lamb of [E]God was He [F#m7]Full atonement, [A2/E]can it be? Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| C#m/E E |]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 man of sorrows what a name for the son of god who came ruined sinners to reclaim hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 2 bearing shame and scoffing rude in my place condemned he stood sealed my pardon with his blood hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 3 guilty vile and helpless we spotless lamb of god was he full atonement can it be hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior
Arrangement.album: Upward: The Bob Kauflin Hymns Project

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [F#m7 | D2 | F#m7 | D2 |]
Verse 1: [F#m9]“Man of Sorrows,” [D2]what a name [F#m9]For the Son of [D2]God who came [F#m9]Ruined sinners [F#m9/E]to reclaim Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| Dmaj9]
Verse 2: [F#m]Bearing shame and [C#m/E]scoffing rude [Dmaj7]In my place con[C#m7]demned He stood [F#m7]Sealed my pardon [C#m/E]with His blood Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| Dmaj9]
Verse 3: [F#m7]Guilty, vile, and [C#m/E]helpless we [Dmaj7]Spotless Lamb of [E]God was He [F#m7]Full atonement, [A2/E]can it be? Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [C#m7] Halle[Dmaj9]lujah,[C#m7] [ ]what a [Dmaj9]Savior. [| C#m/E E |]
{new_page} {key:C} Verse 4: [C/G]Lifted up was [Cmaj7/G]He to die, [F/G]“It is finished!” was His cry [Cmaj7/G]Now in heav’n ex[F2/A]alted [C/G]high Halle[Fmaj9]lujah,[Em7] [ ]what a [Fmaj9]Savior. [| Em7 Am G |] Halle[Fmaj9]lujah,[Em7] [ ]what a [Dm7]Sav[C2]ior. [| Bb2 | Am9 | Dm9 | Am9 | Dm9]
Verse 5: [C/G]When He comes, our [Cmaj7/B]glorious King [F/G]All His ransomed home to bring [Cmaj7/G]Then anew this [Am/F#]song we’ll sing Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [G/F] [ ]what a [F]Savior [| G/F] Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [G/F] [ ]what a [F]Savior [| G Am Em] Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [Em7] [ ]what a [F]Savior [| Em Am G] Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [Em7] [ ]what a [F]Savior [| G Am Em] Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [Em7] [ ]what a [F]Savior [| G Am C Em] Halle[Dm7]lujah, [Em7] [ ]Halle[Fmaj7]lujah, [| Fmaj7] What a [Am9]Savior [Fmaj7 | Am9 | Fmaj7]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 man of sorrows what a name for the son of god who came ruined sinners to reclaim hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 2 bearing shame and scoffing rude in my place condemned he stood sealed my pardon with his blood hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 3 guilty vile and helpless we spotless lamb of god was he full atonement can it be hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 4 lifted up was he to die it is finished was his cry now in heavn exalted high hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior verse 5 when he comes our glorious king all his ransomed home to bring then anew this song well sing hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior hallelujah what a savior hallelujah hallelujah what a savior
Arrangement.album: Upward: The Bob Kauflin Hymns Project
